abstract.text: A SwiftUI view that displays a Mapbox Map.

inlineContent.text: is an entry point to display Mapbox Map in a SwiftUI Application. Typically, you create a
variable of your view. Then you can use
to manage map camera state and animations.
and many others to configure the map appearance and behavior.
and others, to display your content on the map.
style in the dusk light preset, shows the user location indicator (Puck), displays a view annotation with a SwiftUI View inside, draws a polygon, and focuses camera on that polygon.

abstract.text: The preferred frames per second used for map rendering.
The system can change the available range of frame rates because of factors in system policies and a personâ€™s preferences.
Changing this setting maybe beneficial to get smoother experience on devices which support 120 FPS.

When
, all viewport states increase the camera padding by the amount of the safe area insets.

A convex polygon that describes the shape of the screen in case it is non-rectangular.
Every coordinate is in 0 to 1 range, with (0, 0) being the map view top-left and (1, 1) the bottom-right.
The points have to be given in clockwise winding order. The polygon will be closed automatically, so for a rectangular shape, pass in 4 points.
Use this if the visible screen area is obscured enough that using a custom shape improves performance.
